{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3543786,"name":"Ray Flanagan","username":"FloppyDks","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/2acd7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-28T21:11:33.260Z","cooked":"

Hi! We’re trying to go to a set position with our elevator subsystem when a button is pressed. However, when run, the elevator always goes down, no matter what value we give it to go to.

It was working previously, when we had a higher gearbox ratio. Not sure if that’s an issue.

Here’s our code:

github.com

GitHub - EGR-Robotics/5980 at v2

v2

Contribute to EGR-Robotics/5980 development by creating an account on GitHub.

Edit: updated repo link

Elevators want to fall. They need to be held in place all the time against gravity. A higher gearbox and motor brake mode may just have been enough.
Check this link

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Feedforward Control in WPILib

You may have used feedback control (such as PID) for reference tracking (making a system’s output follow a desired reference signal). While this is effective, it’s a reactionary measure; the system...

Sending it to a position is just one part. You need to hold it there also. Check other threads on elevators for more detail.

Hi, thanks for the reply and link. I don’t think I worded my question clear enough.

Our elevator can hold a position well. It’s only when we try to go to a set position does it move down. It’s also not moving down from gravity. The PID Controller is applying voltage to the elevator motor to move down.

public void goToLevel1() {
    double elevatorPos = 120;
    elevatorController.setReference(elevatorPos, ControlType.kPosition, ClosedLoopSlot.kSlot1);
    curElevatorPos = elevatorPos;

Is this the Command where you are having problems?
curElevatorPos is also used as

    curElevatorPos = elevatorEncoder.getPosition();

The hold command uses it as the reference target.
The hold command also uses kSlot0 but there doesn’t seem to be any gains set for it.
The gotoLevel1 command uses kSlot1.
The HoldCommand doesn’t run until one of the gamepad triggers is released.
There are no subsystem requirements to set active commands.

Hi, sorry. Please look at the updated github link (wrong branch).

Here’s our elevator subsystem:

github.com

EGR-Robotics/5980/blob/v2/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/Elevator.java

What I like to do is have the Hold command as the default command. That becomes an issue when you put 2 separate subsytems in one.
Better to split the elevator and arm into their own subsystems then you can have separate default commands.
With the hold command as default the reference value for it can be easily changed by making it a separate variable that your goToLevels can change.
Use PID slot 0 for the position mode.
For manually moving the elevator, you can do it without velocity control. You don’t need to provide a ramp with a separate Thread. There are open and closed loop ramps. If you do want it use kSlot1 and have separate PID settings
While moving you need to update the hold target so it stays where its is when the move command stops.

Thanks for the feedback. We’re already using a hold command as our default command (in RobotContainer). We also have different subsystems for arm and elevator (not sure if you’re looking at the newest v2 branch?).

We are also using a setReference call for the go to position command (currently only L4.java). Not sure if our config (in Constants.java) is incorrect?

Your hold command is setting the motor to -.4.
So you need a - voltage to go up. Does the elevator increase + on the way up?

.feedbackSensor(FeedbackSensor.kPrimaryEncoder)
// Set PID values for position control. We don’t need to pass a closed loop
// slot, as it will default to slot 0.
.p(0.1)
.i(0)
.d(0)
.outputRange(-1, 1)
